title: Glass and clips are great, the stand is trash as it is to ...
body: Glass and clips are great, the stand is trash as it is to small and light it just falls over constantly so I've rigged it to fit into a slotted piece of wood I routed out.

title: Five Stars
body: its ok

title: ... hinges tend to loosen up on their own very easily, and tightening them up hard enough so they ...
body: The hinges tend to loosen up on their own very easily, and tightening them up hard enough so they don't actually hurts my fingers a little. The wingnuts are small & edgy. But it's a good tool for small projects, all it needs is a light!

title: The helping hands are very helpful when I need to ...
body: The helping hands are very helpful when I need to solder. I should have got this a long time ago.

title: Very very handy.
body: I have found this little tool to be very useful. I love it. Highly recommend it. Was shipped on time.

title: it's a pretty decent product but you get what you pay for
body: it's a pretty decent product but you get what you pay for.  It should fit my needs but I will more than likely be looking for something that is not so cheap in price or product.

title: Flimsy design, light stand, weak magnifying glass.
body: I don't use this as much as I thought I would. It's very unstable. Don't let the name mislead you -- it's nowhere near as helpful as an actual hand!

title: Four Stars
body: had to do some fixing on this but other wise it works as needed

title: Clips are OK, magnifying glass is best removed
body: The two clips work well enough, but the magnifying glass is too heavy and unless positioned just so, can cause the whole business to tip over. It's too hard to tighten and loosen the retaining bolt for the glass for adjustment. Finally, the glass was loose in the frame and fell out. Easy enough to push back in, but I finally just removed it entirely and use just the two clips. If there's a version without the glass for less money, I would recommend that over this one.

title: Don't waste your time.
body: As expected you get what you pay for. This has fallen apart several times and it is just a matter of time before I replace it with something of higher quality.

title: Can't solder small items without one.
body: I solder lots of electrical items in my hobby, electric RC planes and Quad copters. This tool is invaluable in holding the wires properly and the magnifier helps with very fine wire. I use it all the time. It replaced an older one that finally gave up the ghost.

title: Great at Holding Small Electronics for Soldering
body: Need a third or fourth hand for helping with your small electronics soldering?  Then this is the item for you.  Made what needed to be done much easier and efficient!    Sure you have to recognize the item is small and delicate; sure you have to have good eye-hand-coordination to use it; and sure you have to have some mechanical aptitude to maximize its benefit.    If you have all these, then it should be a great addition to your 'tool kit'

title: Good helper
body: These things are an absolute MUST for anyone that is doing any sort of soldering or small assembly. This one is well made and works great for me. I do wish it had a taller stand but I just set mine on a block and it works out fine.

title: Soldering has never been easier!
body: I would always have trouble soldering components but then I bought this and now what would take me 30 minutes takes me 5 minutes.

title: Five Stars
body: Such a helpful tool! I use it while working with chain, small metal pieces or tiny polymer clay flowers.

title: well built
body: Pretty small but very handy tool.

title: Cheap made in China crap.
body: Piece of junk made of very cheap materials. The lens came apart right after out the package.

title: A very handy tool
body: I bought this item with fingers crossed after I read the review of other buyers.  At first I did have a problem with it falling over when I tried to use the magnifying glass.  However, I tightened the bolt in the middle of the bar to which the magnifying glass is attached, and it no longer tips over.

title: Better than expected
body: Priced as a disposable but the quality is better than expected. This is a great deal.

title: It Works but not sturdy
body: It is a requirement if you are soldering on boards and need magnification. However for the price, it is doable. The only issue I have with this product is that the fasteners on the clips gets fairly loose after multiple usage. The only way I was able to combat that was to put on some thread lock so that it can retain its tightness. I would highly recommend it, but just note that it is not perfect.

title: Three Stars
body: Unable to stabilize as nuts won't tighten.

title: Five Stars
body: This is a great help

title: Three Stars
body: Kind of a pain keeping every thing tight.

title: Very nice indeed. The item shipped quickly and without any ...
body: Very nice indeed. The item shipped quickly and without any damage. Price is reasonable. I definitely will recommend product like this.

title: Small, Awkward and low quality
body: I expected it to be a little larger. Awkward to use  and broke the first time I used it. Its inexpensive/cheap but you get what you pay for.

title: Usable, not highest quality, but you might need it
body: You get what you pay for - if you have a need for this, it will probably work for you.  The foot could be larger or heavier or magnetic.

title: Five Stars
body: Works great!

title: Horribly cheap - don't purchase
body: This problems with this only ended when I threw it in the garbage!1. The metal portion was not firmly attached to the black base and rotated freely.2. The black base was so light any objects placed within the alligator clips caused the unit to topple over.3. The thumb-screws were so small I couldn't tighten them with my thumbs (maybe a personal problem as my wife says I'm "all thumbs")

title: Four Stars
body: Good enough

title: good in a pinch
body: This is very nice to have when soldering two small wires together. It is inexpensive so as one should expect, the moving joints will loosen up and need to be tightened frequintly. If you are going to do a lot of work with this item you may want to research a better quality one that of course will cost more.

title: good quality.
body: just what I needed, good quality.

title: falls over, difficult to adjust, small magnify lens
body: the base is too small and too unstable. putting anything into this is more of a balancing act than anything. it's supposed to be helping hands, but it should be called "needs helping hands, b/c you will spend lots of time manipulating it.I have drilled holes in the base and bolted to a large peice of wood for stability.I also had to re-attached the aligator clips, as they were about to snap off after a few uses.It will probably end up holding a business card and act as a paper wieght.I am looking elsewhere for a better solution. Maybe this one: http://smile.amazon.com/dp/B00NUDRI68?psc=1

title: Three Stars
body: Needs a heavier base.

title: Four Stars
body: It's good the base could weigh more, so as to be more stable!Bill Graf

title: A good tool
body: I am a textile artist  and I do a lot of shibori.After dyeing,I have to remove many tiny stitches from my fabric.I also make jewelry.This makes my work much easier

title: Your standard helping hands.
body: These helping hands are great for about 1 main reason: they are 5 bucks! Normal quality. But it tips over easy. Would recommend securing it to your workstation. The price is perfect. Would recommend.

title: Five Stars
body: Works great and a must for electronics and small mechanical work. great price, solid base and sturdy.

title: Two a thumbs Up
body: A perfect addition to performing small item photography. Swapped out one of the gator clips with a pair of locking tweezers.

title: Five Stars
body: a real helper!

title: Four Stars
body: It's functional.

title: Helping Hand
body: This Helping Hand Magnifier is an excellent product, wish I had bought it sooner.

title: Lens was a little dirty, but not a big deal
body: Seem a little small but work exceptionally well for the soldering that I am doing. Lens was a little dirty, but not a big deal. Base is heavy and keeps it up right with small electronics being held. Quality seems good. Package was a little damaged but the product was fine.

title: Handy but cheaply built - room for improvement
body: This device for holding things while you work on them is very handy.  Something to hold wires while tinning, parts while soldering together, etc, is nearly essential to get good soldering joints.  I could see it being useful when gluing, too, for non-electronics purposesPROSHighly adjustableMagnifying glass includedTwo clips for holding two parts / wires to be joinedInexpensiveCONSBase is too small to use this with any but small parts without it tippingNo mounting holes so you can screw it into a bench aidTiny spade bolts are too small to tighten with wing-nut with fingers - have to use pliers to get it tightI have modified mine by drilling holes to attach it to a simple bench extension I made of wood for my bench, to hold various accessories steady while working on the bench.  I wish I did not have to use pliers to tighten the wing nuts, but I keep a small pair nearby.

title: The two alligator clips are held to the articulating arms ...
body: The two alligator clips are held to the articulating arms with minimal friction...move them a few times and the clips separate from the base with ease. The clamping units that hold the magnifying glass are almost strong enough to do the job.

title: Five Stars
body: Exactly what I expected  thanks

title: Five Stars
body: thanks works perfect

title: What a pile of garbage! The thumb screws strip out long before you ...
body: What a pile of garbage!  The thumb screws strip out long before you get the swivel joints tight enought to hold anything

title: Five Stars
body: Works just fine.  No problems.

title: Very Helpful
body: Helping hands work as advertised. Decent quality. Bought a 2nd one. I haven't experienced it being too unbalanced with the magnifying glass. Though most things I have used it for were lightweight. I can see it being unbalanced with larger heavier objects. I've considered glueing it to a larger plywood base to reduce this potential problem. For basic electronics it has worked great.

title: Helping Hand- great for holding clasps for jewelry making
body: Do things that weren't possible otherwise- great, versatile tool for me!

title: Bought it because it looked cool and I needed some clutter to fill the voids ...
body: Bought it because it looked cool and I needed some clutter to fill the voids at a new house, didn't think I'd end up using it! Good for any kind of delicate work that you need a few extra hands for.

title: I call this device my 'Second hand' to hold a small object I need to examine!
body: This simple tool is like a second hand, and is able to hold small items that can easily be magnified, or to examine/study it's shape and color.It's worth the price, too!

title: light duty, but inexpensive
body: light duty, but inexpensive.  Everything about this Helping Hands could be improved (hence 4 stars).....  The clips could be stronger alligator types, the lens could be bigger, the base could be heavier, the tension screws could be easier to work.... but it's inexpensive and does the job.  For years I have tried to improvise my own Helping Hands with any number of propped-up rubber band contraptions.... never worked well.  This little device does wonders especially for soldering SMD's.  I find that I use it for more and more projects.

title: Great heavy tool but hard to adjust
body: The base is plenty heavy but the joints are all butterfly wing nuts to tighten it down a lock each joint in position.  I was expecting something easier to use but it does the job well if you do not need to move it much once in position.

title: Five Stars
body: great value

title: Five Stars
body: Very nice product, perfect when you need a second set of hands when soldering wires.

title: I LOVE THIS THING
body: I LOVE THIS THING !!! ... MAGNIFIER IS NOT AS CLEAR AS IT SHOULD BE...BUT THE CONVENIENCE AND STURDINESS MAKE UP WHERE THAT DALLS SHORT

title: Five Stars
body: works great

title: Neat tool
body: A handy gadjet... a full adjustable little helper...a third hand when you need it! great for holding small wires for soldering.

title: Stiff, hard to adjust
body: The arms were a bit stiff and hard to adjust. The clips have ALOT of tension on them and often mar the surfaces of some materials. Once you get it dialed in it works. I wish the base was a bit more weighted as it can tip over fairly easy.Pros:Holds your stuffLots of adjustmentCons:Hard to adjustBase is underweighted, unit likes to tip

title: Cheap but not effective
body: Cheaply made product but for the price can't really be disappointed...I bought 2 just incase the other one breaks, and it did.

title: A little too small.
body: It does what it says, and for dirt cheap it's adequate, but the arms are a little difficult to position properly and the magnifying glass is a little small to make effective space to work.

title: perfect for my hobby soldering electronics
body: perfect for my hobby soldering electronics.it came fully assembled and ready to rock. for those saying it is a little tippy, its all about balance, don't expect the thing to stay up if you flip the glass the opposite side of the base support or by holding pounds of electronic stuff on the clamps! for those wondering to buy, is perfect for the money! all you might need next to you is a good desk lamp cause your head shadows everything while looking over the glass LOL.

title: Poor quality, even for price
body: Item's base has hints of rust and poor paint quality (comes off) and unit fell apart in shipping.Was not expecting the highest quality given the price, but the paint should not be so quick to rub off, nor should there be signs of rust on the base.  Also the unit appears to have separated into 2 pieces during shipping.  One of the clamps came loose separating the main bar (and accompanying lens and alligator clips) from the base.

title: Smaller than you think. Plus it is kind of ...
body: Smaller than you think.  Plus it is kind of a pain to use the clamps and keep everything in place.

title: Five Stars
body: Great

title: dont waste your time.
body: Cheap, small.Get RadioShack's helping hands with integrated LED light and a MUCH bigger mag glass- while you still can.Find a store closing, go and get it for like $5.

title: Four Stars
body: the alligator clips are a little too strong and almost pierce the wiring.

title: Great addition to my tinkering set
body: Great addition to my tinkering set. Pieces are easy to move around and stay in place with little adjustments. I do wish it had more than 2 clips though.

title: Good
body: Good

title: Good but not perfect
body: Have mixed feelings over this product...Pro's:InexpensiveDoes it's job - holding thingsVery positionalMagnifier comes in handyCons:Wish it was a little heavierVery hard to clamp down hard enough to hold things in place with your thumbs alone (use pliers - I'm thinking of maybe trying to rough sand the balls in the ball joint for more friction and change the thumbscrews.)Very hard to put clamps back when they come apart - you need at least 3 hands.But overall, for the money, it's hard to beat. If you have nothing, pick one up. If you can afford it and use it enough to justify the cost, pick up a panavise instead.

title: Not helpful at all
body: I can't even get it together. I came with no instructions for assembly.

title: Four Stars
body: Wish it hada heavier base

title: Great soldering help for the not so steady!
body: This little helping hand has all the attributes that you would want to help you not only hold things steady while you solder, but let you actually SEE what you are soldering, instead of hoping for the best!

title: I like it
body: This is a great product. I use it for detail painting and it works great

title: Say hello to my little friend
body: its my best friend when it come to wiring and soldering a little hard to adjust to the right place but its great to have a helping hand.

title: It does the job
body: I use this a lot, but it's not as nice as I expected. It came out of the cheap, thin cardboard box with a lot of cardboard "lint" all over it. Even after dusting it off it was pretty dull looking. Occasionally I have to push the alligator clips back onto the arm as they tend to get a little loose now and then. I'm considering getting a second helping hands tool which works by clamping your board instead of clipping to it.

title: Hands Free
body: I don't know how I could work on the Helis if I dont have this item. The ease of use and the multiple position you could set it.

title: It doesn't telescope in height - I was hoping to use it in conjunction with a hobby vise but so far I have been unable to figure
body: Be aware - study the dimensions o this item.  It is Very SMALL!  It is quite well made, but smaller than I thought it would be.  It doesn't telescope in height - I was hoping to use it in conjunction with a hobby vise but so far I have been unable to figure out how to do it so it may not be useful for me.  Plan it to be a stand alone device for very small applications.

title: Works great for electrical soldering.
body: Bought this for my electronic projects to hold components wires, etc. when soldering. It will tip with heavier objects, but that's no problem for my use. Magnifying glass is a big help with smaller components.

title: elzique
body: this is a good buy, I am really happy with this item. the Magnifying Glass is very usefull.  this does not feel cheap and for the price it is  a nice tool to add on. I recommend it to all of you guys.

title: Cool
body: Handy little item.  This grabs pieces and holds them in place for them to be worked on. It is also easily put back in box for storage.

title: Works as advertised, it's for holding stuff while you solder, cheap, good.
body: Great product, a little tipsy.  hand articulation is ok.  locking mechanisms have to be screwed so tight they hurt your fingers, magnifying glass is ok.

title: It's okay
body: For the price it's okay. Not superior quality, not a lemon. It had a chip at the border of the lens, but that doesn't make it unusable. Mag glass is not the best quality, but it works. It's stable enough to hold a small part and solder something onto it.

title: Helpful tool
body: Helpful little tool for when I'm painting model cars.  Sometimes you have to figure out the best way to hold the item but you eventually get it.  Plus with the magnifier,  it has proven very useful.

title: Clean before use, works great
body: Cheap and effective.  Like other reviewers mentioned, some of the models have the issues were the paint seems to be coming off.  I found out that I just needed to clean it real well with a cloth before use and now it doesn't flake or leave any residue.

title: s good.
body: It work,s good.

title: Perfect for soldering when you need extra hands
body: I couldn't hardly solder before I bought this because I didn't have enough hands to hold the wires.  Now with this simple tool I can get the wires in the perfect spot before I solder them.  I use it all the time now.Can't beat it for the price!

title: It was to small, I needed one twice that ...
body: It was to small,  I  needed one twice that size..

title: Cheap for a reason
body: Build quality is pretty poor but it's OK if you just need it for occasional soldering jobs. The magnifying glass attachment needs some help. I needed to add a small hose clamp to keep it from flopping around.

title: Take the magnified off before you use this. It's ...
body: Take the magnified off before you use this. It's too heavy and the center set screw will strip out before it ever gets tight enough to hold the magnifier upright.

title: Five Stars
body: I love this product...Very useful in my electronics repair works...

title: Surprisingly great quality
body: I wasn't expecting much for this under-six-dollar gadget. But it is actually quite nice. The base is a heavy cast piece, the clamps and supports are machined steel, and the magnifier is actual glass not plastic.

title: bad
body: just ok does not stand up , keep falling down, bad support

title: Its okay
body: The magnifying glass is fine but the whole stand and clamps were really bad! I had to tighten these really tight to hold a board I had.

title: Falls over easily
body: It looks useful, but it falls over easily.  It needs a bigger base.

title: Base was my only concern but once I got it in my hand I found it sat well and had a good weight to it
body: Solid, hefty. Very adjustable. Base was my only concern but once I got it in my hand I found it sat well and had a good weight to it.

title: light duty helpers with some quirks
body: This is a very affordable gadget, so I did not expect it to knock my socks off... I was basically taking a chance on a low priced item to see if it would suit me and was perfectly fine eating the cost if it did not.My primary use for this is repairing damaged XLR cables and so far the helping hands have indeed helped but with a few caveats that I have to work around.The base it too light. The magnifying lens feels like it weights just as much as the base and even if it doesn't, it makes the unit top heavy and susceptible to tipping over. I tend to not make use of it, but I have managed to make use of it, but I need to be careful not to bump the hands while soldering.The alligator clamps themselves grab and hold cables fine securely. The wing nuts that hold them to the base exist in two states: "loose" and "for the love of god, where are the channel locks?!" so unless you have fingertips of steel, you'll want some pliers nearby.The unit came fully assembled in the box and the glass was covered with cardboard and rubber bands to protect it, but it was just sorta shoved unglamorously into a small cardboard box. Again, it was under 7 bucks.Once I acclimated to working with it, it's fine. I don't solder often and this performs the necessary functions i require. If i soldered more frequently or were doing circuit boards or heavier items, I might be additional ones to use in tandem or upgrade to a heavy duty model or other option, but these are fine.

title: good enough for the price
body: For $6 and free shipping, don't expect an $80 PanaVise. But if you need something for occasional use that is small and easy to put away when not needed, this will do the job.Mine did not have any of the quality issues described in some reviews. It arrived assemble in a box with the glass wrapped in (something)The glass is clear and the magnification is even.The clips are solid with lots of grip. And sharp. They will scratch up the solder mask if you try to move a work piece without touching the clips.The wing-nuts are stamped, so they have rough, sharp edges; a little emery cloth fixed that.And the 1st joint from the base can be hard to tighten enough to hold a position.The base may be "Heavy-Duty" as in it won't break, but it is not very heavy, as in weight. Depending on how you position it, it can tip over under the weight of its own magnifier, so you should expect to use it with light objects or close to vertical. Or clamp the base down. The arms will hold much more than the base will balance.It's not an $80 work piece holder or even a $25 clamp. But it didn't cost $25 or $80 and its worth every bit of the $6 it cost.

title: It works!
body: Very useful!  I work with 110 rc trucks.  I use this for painting and working on wiring. It's not to light that it's going to move around a bunch.  Would be nice if it had some holes to bolt onto a desk though.

title: Wonderful craft equipment
body: This item is going to be very important to me for years to come, as I am an artist and craftsperson. Thank you for a great item and great service!

title: Great little device.
body: Nothing like an extra hand to hold something in place for you.

title: Great third hand
body: This is a great thir hand for the electrical and/or mechanical hobbyist.  I happened to be one now that I have retired.  The addition of the magnifying glass to the device make it useful for us old timers by helping us really see the incredibly shrinking electronic parts clearly.  I have one suggestion  for the next design.  If the heavy base was easily detachable it would be a plus.

title: Meh
body: As other reviewers have mentioned, this product comes just thrown into a box with all the clamps loose so it can fold down compactly in the box.  There was a cardboard sleeve around the magnifying glass to protect it, but it had fallen off.  There is a small crack in the lens as a result.  It will not effect my use though.  I have another one I can use if needed anyway.  I bought it more for the clamps and the stand.It was very easy to get all the parts pointed where I wanted.  It does take a bit of nimble fingers though.  The base is well weighted, and as long as you keep the center of gravity reasonable I don't foresee it tipping over.All in all, I only paid around $8 for it with free shipping so I am very happy with my purchase.  -1 star for the crack in the lens, and -1 for the packaging. Otherwise a 5 star product IMO.

title: Okay, but not well made
body: Interesting tool, and I like what it does, however, when I got it, two of the set screws that hold the arms in place would not screw in at all.  The set screws just did not fit in, I finally just put in some regular screws and the arms work, but this necessitates using a screw driver every time I need to change the arms.  I may try to find some knobbed set screws at the hardware store, that would make it easier to use...but as is...I can only rate it a 3.

title: Four Stars
body: Handy gadget for some tasks.

title: It's okay but...
body: The magnifying glass and the holders are too close, so you really don't have a lot of room to work with, if you're using a bigger soldering iron.

title: SE  MZ101B Helping Hand with Magnifying Glass
body: It's not a bad product but it keeps tipping over on me. That's the only down side to this thing. I have used it mostly for small soldering jobs. Since I don't do a lot of soldering I can live with the fact that it's tippy. If I was using this everyday throughout the day. I would not recommended it, but for my occasional use it's fine. I think the next time I need to use it I will use a bit of duck tape to keep it from tipping. The clips hold things in place nicely and the magnifying glass does come in handy when you are working on small items.

title: Four Stars
body: a little hard to work with but does the job

title: Pretty cool.
body: Thought I would need this for a repair I was doing. Didn't need it, but looks pretty cool and seems pretty stable. Saw a few reviews about tipping. Mine doesn't seem to have that issue. Not too disappointed, I'm sure I will eventually find something to use it for lol.Very sturdyNice ConstructionSo far can't see anything wrong with it =)

title: Five Stars
body: Great product

title: Ok for small things that you keep close in.
body: I used to have a really large one of these that had a very heavy base, so I'm a little spoiled I guess. This device worked fine for me for smaller items, but the base is not particularly heavy, so if you tilt the magnifying glass or move the clips out too far away from center, or if you clip somethig with a little weight to it, the stand will fall over.  It worked fine for waht I needed it for.Also on the plus side, this is almost exactly the same unit as the one they sell at Radio Shack for considerably more money.  It also stores away nicely.

title: A bit clumsy
body: Not a bad buy for the price,does the job...but the Magnifying glass is in an odd spot and not very manuerable

title: fantastic
body: Great little tool to have!

title: Five Stars
body: I needed it yesterday and it works well as always.

title: Five Stars
body: a lot smaller than i expected but worth the cheap price

title: The alligator clips fall off pretty easy, but a squeeze from the pliers usually ...
body: The alligator clips fall off pretty easy, but a squeeze from the pliers usually fixes it for a while. It like to topple a lot too. But then again, it's cheaper than a footlong at subway!

title: Five Stars
body: good

title: Five Stars
body: Great Product, would recommend to all.

title: Great product for the price
body: I needed something to help with soldering and PC repairs, my mother needed something to help her with making necklaces. We found one product to meet both of our needs.

title: i can't believe it!
body: I got the magnifier today which was 7 days ahead which was great. I tried both sides and held it away from me and could see and read with no problems. will be buying again from this seller. :)

title: Cheap.
body: I have one of these I used for about 15 years probably from Radio Shack when Radio Shack was that kind of store.  Went to RS to replace they had a cheap looking product like this for $29.99.  Went on amazon and seen this was low priced.  I was even sent 2 of them by error.  They are very cheaply made.  Feel apart before each was out of the box.  Beware Chinas worst.

title: Five Stars
body: Very useful tool!

title: So helpful.
body: So helpful. Used to help replace nose pads on eyeglasses.

title: good price, excellent quality
body: Quick delivery, good price, excellent quality.  Thank you.

title: Good product
body: I like the idea and I enjoy having the finished product around, however building it was a bit of a drag (even though it only took like 3 minutes).The pinching arms are a bit to hard of a pinch for some of the materials im working with, so Ive put in some cardboard to fix it.

title: Low quality, but it works.
body: I don't know what I expected for 5 bucks. It's fairly low quality and I had to glue the alligator clips on, and I added a felt pad to the bottom. It does it's job for a hobbyist, but I wouldn't rely on this thing for day to day work.

title: Five Stars
body: Great purchase!

title: Love it
body: What a great device

title: Five Stars
body: works great

title: Good value for the money
body: This is not a bad little gadget but it's not exactly what I was hoping for.I've been using it for about two months now for a cleaning ancient coins and working on computer components.Although the base is pretty heavy, I constantly have a problem with it wanting to tip over.  It can easily tip over without anything in the clamps depending on how the magnifying glass is positioned.It's convenient to be able to adjust the position of the clamps and magnifying glass.  However, I find it difficult to twist the very small wing nuts tight enough to hold securely.  Just holding an object for inspection is ok but it's next to impossible to try to work on an object while the clamps are holding it.  Between balancing issues and not being able to tighten the wing nuts enough, I've given up trying to actually "do" anything to an object being held by the clamps.Also, lighting has been tricky because the object has to be very close to the magnifying lens.

title: Works magic when your fingers seem big
body: Cool little tool to have. Thank you

title: The magnifying glass turned out to be a great help for the finer jobs
body: Its worth every penny. I bought it for my husband. He loves to repair everything from customizing guns to repairing electronic gadgets.. I would see him struggle with holding the iron and the wires. This saves so much time and frustration .... The magnifying glass turned out to be a great help for the finer jobs.

title: OK for light use.
body: Actual item is smaller than what it appeared to be in online photos. Well, for what it cost, one can't expect more. It's too small for holding larger pc's or any bulky/heavy stuff. It's fine for wiring applications or holding small and lightweight pc's in place.

title: It's ok
body: It's ok but not what I wanted. So maybe it will work better for someone else. it's doesn't move easily even with all the movable arm. It tips over easily.  Like an old person (Too stiff)

title: Very poor quality. Out of the box
body: Very poor quality. Out of the box, this would not hold a very small board (3x3) I was trying to de-solder and re-solder. I turned the wingnut one time to try and tighten, and it stripped the bolt right away. This would be nice if the materials were a little better. I will have to run to the hardware store to buy new bolts and wing nuts. Could not recommend.

title: somewhat satisfied
body: Meets most of my needs, just a bit smaller than I expected.

title: Two Stars
body: Fell apart pretty quickly after very light use.

title: Flimsy disappointment.
body: I expected much from this, hoping to finally have a flexible mount to do some soldering and minor projects on.Boy am I disappointed. I bought this a few weeks before getting to be able to use it.The big problem with it is how flimsy the middle pivot is (where the silver metal meets the black metal base). No matter how I try to initiate the lock of the main body, it always finds a way to fall over and fail to be useful at all. It just is not sturdy or well made. The clearances in the manufacturing are clearly too high for consistency.I suggest seeking elsewhere, or to get this in person where you can confirm that it can or cannot stay up.

title: One Star
body: Struggled to get the magnifying glass in place. The hinges kept falling apart. It's unusable.

title: For the price its ok
body: A little difficult to adjust and balance the weight. The hands fall off easy. If you will to put up with the unbalancing then its ok for the price.

title: Three Stars
body: the lens holder not so good

title: Its ok
body: Works well, the only thing is that is smaller than I thought - so I don't use it as much as I should.

title: Make Your Own!
body: This is OK, but it needs a better base.  It falls over way too easily.  If you are handy at all, and if you're buying this I would assume that you are, I would recommend making one yourself.  They are just alligator clips and a cheap magnifying glass mounted on universal joints.I definitely plan on making my own and I'm sure it will be better.  Maybe I can at least salvage some parts from this one.

title: Pretty good for the price
body: Really handy, the clamps are not of the best quality but it works

title: Tips over easy
body: This does not stay on the table/bench well. I will probably need to find a way to stick it. I would suggest getting some rubber covers for the alligator clips so you don't have to worry about scratching anything.

title: Nice Little Guy
body: Bought this because I will need it in the future. The base will probably need mounted if i put anything heavy on it. Nice product.

title: Great concept. The unit is a bit unstable unless ...
body: Great concept.  The unit is a bit unstable unless you have the glass centered over the base.  The swivel adjustments work loose if you move it around much.  The frame holding the glass is a bit prone to coming loose. It is worth the low cost of this unit, but if I had to use it everyday I'd want a more reliable unit.

title: a big help!
body: It can be a bit tricky to get the arms and magnifying glass aligned exactly how you want, but it would be MUCH harder without...I used this to solder wiring for LED lights and it was extremely helpful!

title: Useful
body: Very useful tool when working with tiny objects. I use is for painting the fine details on miniatures. Just make sure you have good lighting.For first time use, make sure to have some pliers handy to loosen and tighten the parts into desired postions.

title: junk
body: Not enough weight to stand up and support clips.Screws will not tighten.Not at all useful .Poorly made. Very fast delivery but made in China .Very disappointed.

title: It's OK for the price.
body: I use the piece for both jewelry making and small electronic repair. The base is rather wobbly - it would be wise to find something to secure it to.

title: Two Stars
body: Piece of crap that kept falling apart until I tossed it in the goodwill bin.

title: Five Stars
body: eactly what i needed

title: Very small
body: Works fine otherwise

title: Five Stars
body: Excellent!

title: Four Stars
body: love it

title: Functional and light weight
body: I bought this in conjunction with a soldering iron... I figured why not, and it may help.Looking through the magnifying glass and working on electronics takes some getting used to.The arm clippers are able to move closer or further apart, giving you a wide range of motion and positioning ability.Great for holding two wires together, or touching two small objects, which allows you easily to finalize the connection with solder.I think the base stand could have been a little heavier, or wider. The helping hands fell over a few times while I was trying to setup my two wires for splicing. The stand remained vertical as long as you could fix whatever was causing the imbalance.Might work better if you can secure the base to a table, or make it heavier.

title: Great price
body: and it does just what you need. Magnification is excellent, Have barely used, so I don't know about durability yet. If it somehow explodes and mangles me, I'll update this review.

title: One Star
body: very poor quality

title: could be a little easier to tighten up
body: I have the one with the light got this for the Grandson casting is a little wobbly nothing that cant be fixed good for the use

title: Absolute need for soldering. Perfect for projects.
body: Amazingly helpful. It's so nice for soldering and working with small things. Was extremely easy to fix my headphone wire. very sturdy, completely adjustable. Very strong Alligator clamps. Magnify glass perfect for seeing each wire. Heavy base so it holds quite heavy items. Highly recommended for any project, great for painting small things, and any detailing work at all. Must need.

title: I've seen some bad reviews on this
body: I've seen some bad reviews on this...  It's a very inexpensive solder assistant tool...  It's not going to do the work for you (as some reviewers think it should for the steep price of I think it was $6...)  but it does just fine holding wires and connectors and helping you see what you're doing in the process with the magnifying glass...  I like it, would buy again if it turned up missing, so for the money, it gets five stars...

title: What a Product
body: It arrived early, and was just as expected. It has suited my current needs well, and will do so for all future products!

title: Was missing the piece that connects it to the base ...
body: Was missing the piece that connects it to the base when it arrived. Not a huge problem, but still inconvenient. Works well for small projects where you need both hands

title: it works
body: ok.. so there was a few things i needed to assemble but it definately wasn't 'all in pieces' like other reviewers experienced.The product is pretty small but i think will work well on small objects. (i havent used it on a project yet)I assembled it and 'tested' it with my wrist watch. I clamped the watch straps and used the magnifying glass on the watch back.The magnification was pretty good and it held the watch securely in place.While testing this product i did notice that since it is so small i could see it having tipping issues with something heavier than my wrist watch. However, considering its 'performance' with my wrist watch and taking into account it cost less than seven dollars, i'm satisfied with the value.

title: Five Stars
body: thanks

title: Excellent, would reccomend to others
body: I love this little helping hand -- can't believe how handy it is. I use this for reconstructing wires to work properly and extend them, just as a sidejob. The adjustable arms work perfectly so that I can customize to the size of the wire I'm working on. The clamps are pretty strong, so no chance of anything slipping. That's a very important part when working with small delicate wires.When it came in the mail, it was totally assembled. I used it within 5 minutes. I would never believe how good of a deal I got, I've talked to co-workers and they guessed I paid 40 bucks for it.  This tool has ended a lot of frustration, making my work much more speedy and simple. I used to have to hold wires in place with weighted objects and this is just so much easier.This is the best product to buy for this.

title: A disappointment - I can't recommend this
body: This is a poor knockoff of a device made much better by others. The clamping screws can't be tightened to hold as they should an as a result, the thing just doesn't work.

title: the only bad thing is that a lot disarmed
body: Ideal for electronic projects, the only bad thing is that a lot disarmed, but when squeezed well, you have no problem.

title: It helps
body: I bought this product to help with soldering of small pieces. It does work and help with certain things. There are certain things that I have tried to setup to hold in place with this and had a difficult time. For the most part, the price was decent and works for most of my projects.

title: Four Stars
body: nice

title: its a little small
body: the leavers that hold the clamps are hard to tighten enough to stay in place. and it is smaller than i thought it was.  but it is a big help.

title: Four Stars
body: Holds small parts for soldering

title: Four Stars
body: Its a little on the cheap side but works.

title: SE MZ101B Helping Hands with Magnifying Glass
body: This arrived on time and was packed well just what I needed and you can’t beat the price I will recommend this to anyone that needs a 3 hand for their projects thanks you so much.

title: Five Stars
body: great price and used a lot by my son

title: Great to weld jewelry,
body: You often need a third hand to weld something and this workd well. None of the craft stores sold these.

title: Cheap
body: When I took the product out of the box I was fairly unimpressed. It looked cheaply made right out of the box because of loose parts everywhere. Within 5 minutes of holding something small a wing nut stripped out and it all fell apart. I'm going to return the item to amazon today.Pros:Heavy, won't tip over.Includes magnifying glassCons:Loose PartsEasy to strip out a wingnut

title: Five Stars
body: It is an excellent tool to make better projects.

title: I like that I can set this in any direction I ...
body: I like that I can set this in any direction I want to do the work I need to do.

title: Usefull tool
body: I put the holder in a vise to hold a printed circuit board to remove and replace bulbs on the printed circuit.  Works good and the magnifying glass is a plus

title: it will serve it's purpose
body: it will serve it's purpose but it is not stable and i have to velcro it the table top to keep it from toppling over and the magnifying glass fell off the first time i used it.  you get what you pay for.

title: Need a helping hand?
body: I'm using this to help view my vape-coils while I'm building them. The magnifier has helped incredibly. The helping hands are cool, but I don't have a need for them. The base has a good weight to it, so there isn't much movement. The adjuster screws are also easily figured out, and maneuvered.

title: Five Stars
body: Oh Ya

title: smaller than expected
body: item smaller than I expected. seems to work ok though

title: Can't beat the price
body: Great for inspection and repair of electronics and all sorts of electrical repairs. Frees up the hands for more accurate soldering.

title: If you can't be handsome at least be handy!
body: This is a great little tool if you have soldering or small gluing projects. The base is weighted which helps hold things while you work. (I would suggest you glue a small rubber pad on the bottom, as the medal base will slide on a hard surface.) The magnifying glass is quite good for its size, 4X power. Don't leave the magnifying glass in direct sun as any magnifier can be a fire hazard under the right conditions.  All in all, a small price to pay for good quality and a nice gadget.[...]

title: Indispensably helpful
body: Sometimes, when soldering electronics, you need three or even 4 hands to get the job done.Problem solved!This, plus a nice PCB-vise and you're set.

title: Helpfull
body: I like the design and I've used this quite  bit for intricate work, while whittling and with some soldering, however after only a little manipulation I realized that the wing nuts just weren't sufficient and I replaced them with some regular bolts and locking nuts that I tightened with pliers and and put some rubber washers in to make sure there was grip, but the positioning is perfect and I amd very leased with the purchase.

title: Works for small items.
body: Make sure you're aware that the base for this is small and not very heavy. It will fall over on itself with a small item in the clasps if it's not balanced. I'm thinking about gluing the base to a heavier block. The clasps and construction are fine, it's just not very heavy.

title: the stand is not heavy enough and sometimes fall on ...
body: the stand is not heavy enough and sometimes fall on the piece you are working on - apart that, a practical device

title: Four Stars
body: Just the job.

title: Does what I bought it for. Would have gave ...
body: Does what I bought it for.  Would have gave it 5 stars if the base was a little larger an heavier.

title: Cheap & Flimsy
body: Cheap product with no way to securely attach the "Helping Hands" to the base. The stud just loosely fits into a hole in the base but is not secure. You have to glue or weld the stud into the base. Would have been so simple to have a threaded stud and nut at the very least. Go to Radio Shack and buy a decent product. Would have returned it but wasn't worth the time or effort, just threw it out.

title: Five Stars
body: AAAAAAAAAA++++++ VERY FAST SHIPPING VERY HAPPY

title: Good only if you're soldering
body: I definitely like this little magnifying glass do-hickey. I have a few issues with it, though:It's not sturdy very sturdy. You can't clip anything too heavy onto it, as the arms can't handle the weight.The base isn't mountable (you can't screw it down...that's what I was expecting).It's cheaply made, so don't expect heavy use with this little guy. I bought it for jewelry making, but it's more suited for soldering electrical wires.All in all, I'd buy it again, but only because it's so inexpensive.

title: Small
body: It is much smaller than I probably need. I use it for jewelry and have to constantly battle it, but the magnification is good.

title: Wonderful tool which acts as a third hand.
body: Wonderful tool at such a low price.  Indispensable for close work.

title: Four Stars
body: Love it esp when it comes to small wires, I can actually see them now
